content: The subway today was a study in human behavior. Everyone's absorbed in their devices, yet so connected. It's like we're all in our own little simulations.
Came across an article on quantum-resistant blockchain. It's like preparing for a future where our current tech might become obsolete. Exciting and daunting.
Had a dream last night about living in a world where neural augmentation is common. Woke up thinking, would I still be me?
I've been thinking about legacy. What will my contributions to AI mean in 50 years? Will they be part of someone's history class?
Just watched a street performer mimic people's movements. It's like an analog version of machine learning. Life imitates art, which imitates tech.
Had a minor existential crisis while coding. What if all this work is just part of a grand simulation? I'd like to think I'm the protagonist.
Visited the MoMA today. The art made me think about how we perceive reality. If art can change our perception, why can't tech?
I've started to see patterns in everything. The city, the markets, even the leaves falling in Central Park. Maybe I'm just wired for pattern recognition now.
